headline: 'The Five' on Biden blaming Trump for Afghanistan

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone, I'm Greg Gutfeld along with Dagen McDowell, Geraldo Rivera, Jesse Watters and a grape is her yoga ball,  Dana Perino. It is 5:00 p.m. in the New York City. This is THE FIVE.  First he was in denial, now President Biden is apparently delusional about  the disaster in Afghanistan. While the Taliban has taken over the country President Biden seems confused by mixing updates in claiming no one has  been killed.

utterances.speaker: GEORGE STEPHANOPOULOS, ABC NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Still a lot of pandemonium outside   the airport.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: Oh, there is, but look, but no one's being killed right now. God forgive me for it if I'm   wrong about that, but no one's being killed right now. People are -- we got a thousands, somewhere 1,200 out yesterday, a couple thousand a day, and it's increasing. We're going to get those people out.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.sentences: But we've all seen the pictures. We've seen those hundreds   of people packed into a C-17. We've seen Afghans falling --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: That was four days ago, five days ago.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.sentences: What did you think when you first saw those pictures?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: What I thought was we have to gain control of this. We have to move  this more quickly. We have to move in a way in which we can take control of  that airport. And we did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Here's the reality on the ground. Twelve people have reportedly   died so far. New video shows people running for their lives after the Taliban opened fire. There's panic and chaos outside the country's single evacuation point at the Kabul airport. And mothers are hanging their  children -- handing their children over the wall to soldiers to get them  out. But President Biden says what is happening was inevitable.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.sentences: It sounds like you think we should have gotten out a long time ago.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We should have.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.sentences: And accept the idea that it was going to be messy no matter what.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Well, why though -- what would be messy?

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.sentences: The --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: If we had gotten out a long time ago -- getting out would be messy no matter when it occurred.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, Dana, that was a -- there's so many contradictions in differences between old Joe and new Joe and his general saying they didn't  see it coming, but he said it was going to happen no matter what. It's just like -- it's not -- it's no longer a question of whether we should leave or   stay. The question is how awful was this? Planned or not planned.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: I was thinking today about, you know, in the 70s, the talk about malaise.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right? And do you remember Krauthammer, Charles Krauthammer. The late Charles Krauthammer wrote a piece a few years before he died called, "Decline as a Choice." And I was thinking a little bit about that today   because when this morning I watched the interview live at 7:00 a.m. and  when President Biden said, well, nobody's dying, you know. Well, correct me if I'm wrong, and knock wood -- he's knocking wood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I was like, Americans don't knock wood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We knock heads.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I don't understand the point of sending 8,000 more troops in  there to help get people out if we can't get people out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: If we can't get people to the airport. You have reports that French and British Special Forces are -- they're not waiting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're going in to try to find their people. He does seem disconnected. I don't want the military to get demoralized. We need them to be strong, but it sounds -- it seems to me that what I saw today at the  Pentagon is that they want to do more but the commander-in-chief is not authorizing it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. You know, there was a, Dagen, there was a poll done by Mission Roll Call. It's a veteran's advocacy group of 1.2 million vets, and   they found that 71 percent found that this recent mess has caused them personal sadness because of all the work they put in and seeing it end this.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: But they have to know that every  American sees the disaster created by Joe Biden and that every American is deeply grateful for what -- for the most part has been a counter-terrorism operation in Afghanistan to deny a haven to Al-Qaeda. And that was the --  it wasn't nation-building that was the reason we were there. And we are deeply grateful for that and we know firsthand like I've been contacting friends of mine who served, and just trying to reach out to them which is what we all do because we have empathy and we have hearts and we have souls and we believe in prayer. That being said, you mentioned new Joe versus old Joe. I think that there's just one Joe. When he speaks it's a debacle. When he doesn't speak it's a  debacle. He's plumbing new depths of moronery (ph) in a career, what a 50- year career in government highlighted by the fact that he opposed the raid to kill Osama Bin Laden. Andy McCarthy once said, mediocrity would have been something to strive for in Joe Biden's prime. One more thing in terms of finances. I heard Geraldo speaking earlier about the opium.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: The Taliban controls the largest opium operation in the world. Well, we're also giving up treasure and power to China because China is quickly moving into Afghanistan. Afghanistan has one of the largest reserves of rare earth metals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Which we need for electric cars and solar panels and wind turbines. China already controls 80 percent of the production of rare earth  metals. They're going in delighted to offer mining assistance to the Taliban. They're just beginning to develop this relationship, but again, that hands money to the Taliban potentially trillions of dollars in the long run and it hands more power to China. So it's a lose-lose for the United States again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, Jesse, we're talking about how I don't want us to become like how CNN was with Trump where every day it was the -- the walls  are closing in, you know, tick, tick, tick boom. Something bad is going to -- they were -- became obsessed, but it's like -- so you try to -- you try to measure the criticism of Biden, but it's hard at this point.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Because here's the truth, the president has stranded thousands of Americans in a war zone and the only way for them to get out is an airport that's surrounded by an enemy. An enemy that's

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Today.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Three-hundred. Thousands of Afghans have got -- only 300 today. And we don't know how many Americans are there. They say 10,000, 15,000. We don't know and we don't have the capability to go out and extract them. And all Joe Biden needs to say to make everyone feel confident is that the United States is going to do everything within our power no matter how long it takes to get all of our people home safely.  Do you think this would ever happen with Donald Trump? Donald Trump would never leave people behind in a hostile country like this. He was renowned for bringing back hostages. That was one of the best accomplishments in four years. So, "The New York Times" is reporting that Joe Biden was briefed throughout the summer that there were mass desertions going on within the Afghan army, collapse was rapidly occurring, and the Taliban takeover may have been imminent. Now, he didn't do anything about that. Didn't change his plan. Went out and lied to the American people and said everything's going to be just fine. I don't foresee it happening. So, the question is, did the commander-in- chief lie to the American people, strand thousands of Americans behind enemy lines, abandoned billions of dollars of lethal military equipment just to get a political photo op to pull out on 9/11? So Republicans, when they take the House back, they're going to have to decide is this high crime or misdemeanor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What do you think, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Well, it's -- I hardly know where to begin. I will say in terms of the evacuation fiasco, it shows that there was no pre-playing. The fact that we've had to surge all these thousands of G.I.'s to the airport to the Kabul airport, you know, why were -- why did we take them out to now bring them back? It just shows an absolute utter failure in terms of planning. I don't think that Biden is lying. I just think that there is a degree of incompetence --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We don't know that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- that is being exposed here. I don't --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We don't know if he's --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I don't think he's evil. Let me just say this --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's not what I said. He could be a liar and not be evil.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I don't -- I don't know how you do that, but I guess --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're a politician.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes, I guess so. There's an image today and Greg you alluded to it at the top of the show and I spoke about it with Martha MacCallum earlier, where the mom hands the infant to the G.I. who takes and grazes the child over the (inaudible) of the barbed wire. You know, your heart breaks because number one, it shows the absolute dysfunction of the evacuation. Here's a mom, when did you last see those images of moms handing babies to benign force so the baby doesn't get harmed? I hate to bring up the illusions, but it is unbelievably heart-wrenching to watch, but it also says another thing about America. Yes, we screwed up the plan, there was no evacuation plan. It was total dysfunction, but once that child was in that G.I.'s hand, you knew, we knew that that child was safe. That's America. We're going to get this -- we're going to get through this. We're going to get these people out. We're going to get our people out first as we should and we get the people that are like dear friends of ours who put their heart and soul on the line for America. We're going to get them out. It's screwed up. It was bad, but eventually the child will be in the arms of the G.I.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, I hope so. Coming up, Biden can't get his story straight on what went wrong in Afghanistan. His latest excuse, next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: President Biden says the buck stops with him, but the guy just can't stop blaming others for his own mistakes. The defensive president keeps passing the blame for the complete Taliban takeover of Afghanistan. Biden trying to throw the intelligence community under the bus.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: There was no consensus. You go back and look at the intelligence reports. They said that it was like more likely to be sometime by the end of the year.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.sentences: Your top military advisors warned against what's drawing on this timeline. They wanted you to keep about 2,500 troops.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: No, they didn't. It was split. That wasn't true. That wasn't true.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.sentences: So no one -- no one told -- your military advisor did not tell you no, we should just keep 2,500 troops. It's been a stable situation for the last several years. We can do that. We can continue to do that.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: No. No one said that to me that I can recall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, that's three different answers he's given, right, Dana? He said it in the question and answer session last month, no. Then he said it was split, and then again he said no. Which one is it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But then what did -- what did he add at the end of the last one, which is not that I recall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not that I recall.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that is a way to -- well, I mean, that could be the case. I'm sure he gets a lot of briefings, but we know that back in April in the White House briefing room, they said that the military suggested this and we knew this because it was on the front page of every paper.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean if you read any of the news, it was there. We covered it at the time as we're following the story. And it -- certainly, it's a fact that intelligence reports are a judgment call. This is our best assessment. This is what we have right now. But the reason that a commander-in-chief is there is because you get to make the decision. You have to make the decision. That is a decision-making job. So the decision does rest with him and I think that when you have tension between an intelligence community and a president that's never good for anybody.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And President Trump, former President Trump, he came out and had a statement that said basically you get the equipment out then you get the interpreters out then you get the people out and the last people to come out are the military. Biden did it in reverse.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Right. It seems like when Biden talks about this, he at least believes he's being truthful. He's wanted the troops out. He was focused on the troop level because that was going to be the political win.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: If we get -- he got him down to a few hundred, right? And so he was going to take him down. Originally the date was 9/11. That was just, well, appalling so they moved it up to late August. But he was most focused so you take the troops out which is -- and I talked to somebody about this today. Common sense says you get the civilians out including the Afghan allies then the diplomats and the last people to leave are your military, the people on the ground. And in terms of the intelligence, couldn't Joe Biden use a like a laptop from Hunter to pop up now or you know crack sex tape to show up, but see, the intel community's turned against him so I guess that won't just appear out of nowhere.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, Geraldo, they're going to have hearings on this they're saying in September and they're going to have people testifying from the intelligence community, you know, what did you know? When did you know it? What did you tell the president? They're going to subpoena documents. How's that going to shake out?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, Dana knows government much better than I.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not necessary.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: No, I believe that. I really respect you because you have a depth of knowledge that -- I have a kind of a superficial knowledge, but --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait a second. Did Geraldo just say somebody does something better than him?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I've got -- I've got --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think there's a but coming. I think there's a but coming.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I got a million -- I got a million yards.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We got -- we're going to have to shut down this show. This is too weird. This is bigger. This is bigger than Watergate.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think that the intelligence community is full of crap. I think they're totally self-inflated. I think they're the most important people in Washington. They go around strutting around, oh, I know, I got this and anytime I see them overseas, they don't know -- they are cocktail people. They are chartered jet people. They're not the -- they're not the grumpy people that got Osama Bin Laden in the movies. I just think that this -- those people who are advising, and they -- and they -- they're -- you know, what they do best? Leak. They are great leakers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So the (inaudible) Anderson (ph).

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They're great leakers. (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But I have to just give you one factoid right now. The banks in Afghanistan are empty. There's not a dime left. They robbed everything. The United States has cut off all credit to Afghanistan. Nobody's picking up the garbage. The lights are going to go out soon that are still -- that are still burning. The water is not going to be working in a little bit. Those cell phones that they all treasure, the cell towers are going to go down. The reason the Taliban is playing ball right now is they know they have not a chance in Shinola to get that fixed without a whole lot of help. And if they don't play ball and let these people out, you know, I'm not saying anything -- I'm not trying to justify the mistakes that were made by us. But I believe that this situation, while not redeemable, we're not going to ever go back to Afghanistan. We do have some leverage right now to have a humane evacuation, but I think America has to come to grips with the fact that we're going to have tens of thousands of Afghans coming to America. Get over it. We're going to absorb. We're going to --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We're basically paying all these people to come out, that's what's happening.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And then when -- and then when it's done --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- China and Pakistan are going to swoop in with the cash. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Anytime you decide you're going to leave, that's sending a signal, no matter what. So, I find that the worst thing that Biden is doing is blaming the Afghan army and saying that they didn't fight as hard because if you know that the exit's coming and everybody apparently knew this was coming, they also knew that the Taliban was going to become the new boss. So, why tangle with the new landlord? If you know that you're not going to get air power and you know the United States is leaving, it seems that the fast transition that the Afghan army was allowing was just them looking out for their self-interest. It's like what -- like why fight, why go down with the ship, right? If the ship -- why don't I just, you know, I don't want them to kill my family so we'll just let them in. They made deals. I think in terms of accountability, they have -- we have to go further back. There were -- I mean, again, I always say it's on my head. I take responsibility for ignoring certain things. And, you know, I ignored claims of well-documented stories about fraud and misuse of funds because it wasn't, like it was Afghanistan. It was so confusing and blah, blah, blah or it was maybe it was just part of anti-war assumptions that I thought were silly, but they ended up being right. You're talking like $600 billion lost in grifting and corruption out of a war that cost over a trillion. That needs to be looked at. Where did this money go? Who wanted this war to keep going to make money I think is a really good thing. And lastly, just a recommendation for a movie, one of the best war movies is an Afghanistan movie called "The Beast." I don't know if anybody have seen it, but it's probably around --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: How about the "Kite Runner?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I never saw that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know if it's a movie. The book, yes. I know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good book.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The book's better than the movie, Geraldo. Right, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I was actually just going to say that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right. Dana and I know. Ahead, President Biden ramping up his war on Republican governors who defy masked mandates and Ron DeSantis is hitting back hard.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Another major clash over mask mandates in schools. President Biden scolding Republican governors and directing his Department of Education to sue them for blocking mask restrictions. But Florida Governor Ron DeSantis is hitting back saying the president has other problems to worry about.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Have you seen throughout this pandemic some politicians are trying to turn public safety measures that is children wearing masks in school into political disputes for their own political gain. If you aren't going to fight COVID-19, at least get out of the way.

utterances.speaker: RON DESANTIS, GOVERNOR OF FLORIDA
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden thinks the federal government should come in and overrule the parents and force these young kids to wear these masks. And you got to wonder, where are your priorities? You're letting Afghanistan burn, our border burn and so many other things in our country fall to pieces.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I like that guy, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But that is gaslighting. He is trying to change the subject. The subject is Florida leads the nation in the most new cases per capita. Florida leads the nation in the most hospitalizations per capita, and he's talking about Biden and Afghanistan. Why isn't he dealing with -- yes, he's running for president, I get that but.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I always -- I'm super skeptical when we only deal with a single variable like cases. I want to know what the severity is. I want to know are these people that aren't vaccinated are vaccinated? Are they elderly? Do they have other issues? That -- and are the cases asymptomatic? A lot of them are.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Are you arguing that COVID is not a problem in Florida and that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. No.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, that my point is he should --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to -- I'm not getting into this --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He's being criticized by Biden about COVID. Mask mandates

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, Biden is doing -- Biden is doing this because he's in trouble. This is the only way he's going to maintain any relevance. He's mortally wounded by Afghanistan. So this debate is only here for artificial reasons. I think we live in a time now where we hold more contempt for our political adversaries than actual terrorists. It's why you keep hearing people from Michael Moore to Stephen Colbert comparing Republicans and Trump voters to the Taliban. Now, if I were -- if I were like them and god knows I'm not, I would point to the Democrats and say, it's interesting how maniacal they are about having people cover up. I mean, perhaps the mask is their burka, don't you think. I mean, the fact is, you know, they're so hot on mask mandates. They seem to have that same authoritarian inclination that the Taliban has, you know, for people to do what they say. But I would never say that --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, you would never.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because I'm not -- I'm not a hack. I will point out however that in Martha's Vineyard, the hospitals are seeing its largest number of COVID and non-COVID-related patients since the pandemic began. And a hack would probably point out that there was this massive big bash at Martha's Vineyard who by someone whose name might rhyme with --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I thought you were going to behave --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- Sharack Slobama, but I'm not going to do that. I'm going to say that the rise of COVID at Martha's Vineyard were a bunch of pro-Trump fishermen that just showed up there on the island.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Probably so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So, Dana, would you -- how would you advise Governor DeSantis?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, the thing is that he's counterpunching, right? So, he didn't pick the fight with Biden. He is governing. So, he is the elected governor of Florida. He's saying, here's what I'm saying to schools. He's not saying you are not allowed to wear a mask at school. He's saying that there should be choice and I believe in like local control. I think that's good. But you mentioned that -- you think that DeSantis is gaslighting by changing the subject. That's exactly what President Biden did yesterday --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: When he came out and gave a whole speech about booster shots, which are fine. I mean, that's fine. But it was obviously not the issue of the day. And that is something that the Secretary of Health and Human Services or the vice president could have done for him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Also, I'm tired of people using the word gaslighting incorrectly. Just because people are having a debate --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I used it exactly correct.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Gaslighting is you -- something really bad is happening to you. And I'm telling you, it's not happening.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You get caught cheating, and you say why didn't you do the dishes? That's gaslighting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, perhaps. I've never done that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The dishes?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's a fact of life that Florida is suffering and DeSantis, you know, for all his swashbuckling, the proof is in the pudding.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: DeSantis is saying, as Republicans say that it's up to the parents to decide what's best for the kids. The Democrats are saying, I want the government to force what we think is best for all of the kids. And that's a great difference between the left and the right. DeSantis, as Dana said, he's not saying you're not allowed to wear a mask if you're a child, he just says you have the option. What's wrong with options? What's wrong with choice, Geraldo? That's the issue. And Biden thinks he's right on the polling, but he's wrong on the facts. There's a new study. 25,000 school-aged children, listen to these physical, psychological behavioral problems that have come from mask- wearing in schools. Increased headaches, difficulty concentrating -- I had that normally -- drowsiness or fatigue, malaise, sleep issues, shortness of breath, dizziness. Do you want children dizzy and passing out, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's gaslighting it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, you don't. And if there really was --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I feel -- I feel dizzy listening to that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, right, because the facts make you dizzy, Geraldo. And there hasn't been a school that's been a super spreader.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's is just not true. If there was, it'd be all over the news.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA

utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I don't understand the point of sending 8,000 more troops in there to help get people out if we can't get people out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If we can't get people to the airport. You have reports that French and British Special Forces are -- they're not waiting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They're going in to try to find their people. He does seem disconnected. I don't want the military to get demoralized. We need them to be strong, but it sounds -- it seems to me that what I saw today at the Pentagon is that they want to do more but the commander-in-chief is not authorizing it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. You know, there was a, Dagen, there was a poll done by Mission Roll Call. It's a veteran's advocacy group of 1.2 million vets, and they found that 71 percent found that this recent mess has caused them personal sadness because of all the work they put in and seeing it end this.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: But they have to know that every American sees the disaster created by Joe Biden and that every American is deeply grateful for what -- for the most part has been a counter-terrorism operation in Afghanistan to deny a haven to Al-Qaeda. And that was the -- it wasn't nation-building that was the reason we were there. And we are deeply grateful for that and we know firsthand like I've been contacting friends of mine who served, and just trying to reach out to them which is what we all do because we have empathy and we have hearts and we have souls and we believe in prayer. That being said, you mentioned new Joe versus old Joe. I think that there's just one Joe. When he speaks it's a debacle. When he doesn't speak it's a debacle. He's plumbing new depths of moronery (ph) in a career, what a 50- year career in government highlighted by the fact that he opposed the raid to kill Osama Bin Laden. Andy McCarthy once said, mediocrity would have been something to strive for in Joe Biden's prime. One more thing in terms of finances. I heard Geraldo speaking earlier about the opium.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: The Taliban controls the largest opium operation in the world. Well, we're also giving up treasure and power to China because China is quickly moving into Afghanistan. Afghanistan has one of the largest reserves of rare earth metals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Which we need for electric cars and solar panels and wind turbines. China already controls 80 percent of the production of rare earth metals. They're going in delighted to offer mining assistance to the Taliban. They're just beginning to develop this relationship, but again, that hands money to the Taliban potentially trillions of dollars in the long run and it hands more power to China. So it's a lose-lose for the United States again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. You know, Jesse, we're talking about how I don't want us to become like how CNN was with Trump where every day it was the -- the walls are closing in, you know, tick, tick, tick boom. Something bad is going to -- they were -- became obsessed, but it's like -- so you try to -- you try to measure the criticism of Biden, but it's hard at this point.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Because here's the truth, the president has stranded thousands of Americans in a war zone and the only way for them to get out is an airport that's surrounded by an enemy. An enemy that's committing atrocities every single day on camera for the world to see. And I don't think the president understands that this is going to dominate the news cycle until every single American is evacuated safely. And sadly, he's created a kill zone. In the military they say that's where every single person that wants to leave has to funnel through the same route that's controlled by who? The enemy. So they're going to block them. They're going to kidnap them. They're going to shake them down or they might kill them. So now we have an Afghan hostage crisis where Americans are going to have to pay bribes to the Taliban to get out. The U.S. government might be paying them. Cash is king. Private entities could be paying them. We don't know, but we're going to have to be paying terrorists to evacuate Americans. Now, I know we want to get Afghans out too, but I want to get Americans out. That should be a priority. And right now, I think only 300 Americans left.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Today.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Three-hundred. Thousands of Afghans have got -- only 300 today. And we don't know how many Americans are there. They say 10,000, 15,000. We don't know and we don't have the capability to go out and extract them. And all Joe Biden needs to say to make everyone feel confident is that the United States is going to do everything within our power no matter how long it takes to get all of our people home safely. Do you think this would ever happen with Donald Trump? Donald Trump would never leave people behind in a hostile country like this. He was renowned for bringing back hostages. That was one of the best accomplishments in four years. So, "The New York Times" is reporting that Joe Biden was briefed throughout the summer that there were mass desertions going on within the Afghan army, collapse was rapidly occurring, and the Taliban takeover may have been imminent. Now, he didn't do anything about that. Didn't change his plan. Went out and lied to the American people and said everything's going to be just fine. I don't foresee it happening. So, the question is, did the commander-in- chief lie to the American people, strand thousands of Americans behind enemy lines, abandoned billions of dollars of lethal military equipment just to get a political photo op to pull out on 9/11? So Republicans, when they take the House back, they're going to have to decide is this high crime or misdemeanor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What do you think, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Well, it's -- I hardly know where to begin. I will say in terms of the evacuation fiasco, it shows that there was no pre-playing. The fact that we've had to surge all these thousands of G.I.'s to the airport to the Kabul airport, you know, why were -- why did we take them out to now bring them back? It just shows an absolute utter failure in terms of planning. I don't think that Biden is lying. I just think that there is a degree of incompetence --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We don't know that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- that is being exposed here. I don't --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We don't know if he's --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't -- I don't think he's evil. Let me just say this --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not what I said. He could be a liar and not be evil.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't -- I don't -- I don't know how you do that, but I guess --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're a politician.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes, I guess so. There's an image today and Greg you alluded to it at the top of the show and I spoke about it with Martha MacCallum earlier, where the mom hands the infant to the G.I. who takes and grazes the child over the (inaudible) of the barbed wire. You know, your heart breaks because number one, it shows the absolute dysfunction of the evacuation. Here's a mom, when did you last see those images of moms handing babies to benign force so the baby doesn't get harmed? I hate to bring up the illusions, but it is unbelievably heart-wrenching to watch, but it also says another thing about America. Yes, we screwed up the plan, there was no evacuation plan. It was total dysfunction, but once that child was in that G.I.'s hand, you knew, we knew that that child was safe. That's America. We're going to get this -- we're going to get through this. We're going to get these people out. We're going to get our people out first as we should and we get the people that are like dear friends of ours who put their heart and soul on the line for America. We're going to get them out. It's screwed up. It was bad, but eventually the child will be in the arms of the G.I.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Well, I hope so. Coming up, Biden can't get his story straight on what went wrong in Afghanistan. His latest excuse, next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: President Biden says the buck stops with him, but the guy just can't stop blaming others for his own mistakes. The defensive president keeps passing the blame for the complete Taliban takeover of Afghanistan. Biden trying to throw the intelligence community under the bus.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: There was no consensus. You go back and look at the intelligence reports. They said that it was like more likely to be sometime by the end of the year.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.utterance: Your top military advisors warned against what's drawing on this timeline. They wanted you to keep about 2,500 troops.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: No, they didn't. It was split. That wasn't true. That wasn't true.

utterances.speaker: STEPHANOPOULOS
utterances.utterance: So no one -- no one told -- your military advisor did not tell you no, we should just keep 2,500 troops. It's been a stable situation for the last several years. We can do that. We can continue to do that.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: No. No one said that to me that I can recall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, that's three different answers he's given, right, Dana? He said it in the question and answer session last month, no. Then he said it was split, and then again he said no. Which one is it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But then what did -- what did he add at the end of the last one, which is not that I recall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not that I recall.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And that is a way to -- well, I mean, that could be the case. I'm sure he gets a lot of briefings, but we know that back in April in the White House briefing room, they said that the military suggested this and we knew this because it was on the front page of every paper.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean if you read any of the news, it was there. We covered it at the time as we're following the story. And it -- certainly, it's a fact that intelligence reports are a judgment call. This is our best assessment. This is what we have right now. But the reason that a commander-in-chief is there is because you get to make the decision. You have to make the decision. That is a decision-making job. So the decision does rest with him and I think that when you have tension between an intelligence community and a president that's never good for anybody.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And President Trump, former President Trump, he came out and had a statement that said basically you get the equipment out then you get the interpreters out then you get the people out and the last people to come out are the military. Biden did it in reverse.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Right. It seems like when Biden talks about this, he at least believes he's being truthful. He's wanted the troops out. He was focused on the troop level because that was going to be the political win.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: If we get -- he got him down to a few hundred, right? And so he was going to take him down. Originally the date was 9/11. That was just, well, appalling so they moved it up to late August. But he was most focused so you take the troops out which is -- and I talked to somebody about this today. Common sense says you get the civilians out including the Afghan allies then the diplomats and the last people to leave are your military, the people on the ground. And in terms of the intelligence, couldn't Joe Biden use a like a laptop from Hunter to pop up now or you know crack sex tape to show up, but see, the intel community's turned against him so I guess that won't just appear out of nowhere.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, Geraldo, they're going to have hearings on this they're saying in September and they're going to have people testifying from the intelligence community, you know, what did you know? When did you know it? What did you tell the president? They're going to subpoena documents. How's that going to shake out?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, Dana knows government much better than I.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's not necessary.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: No, I believe that. I really respect you because you have a depth of knowledge that -- I have a kind of a superficial knowledge, but --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait a second. Did Geraldo just say somebody does something better than him?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I've got -- I've got --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think there's a but coming. I think there's a but coming.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I got a million -- I got a million yards.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We got -- we're going to have to shut down this show. This is too weird. This is bigger. This is bigger than Watergate.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think that the intelligence community is full of crap. I think they're totally self-inflated. I think they're the most important people in Washington. They go around strutting around, oh, I know, I got this and anytime I see them overseas, they don't know -- they are cocktail people. They are chartered jet people. They're not the -- they're not the grumpy people that got Osama Bin Laden in the movies. I just think that this -- those people who are advising, and they -- and they -- they're -- you know, what they do best? Leak. They are great leakers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So the (inaudible) Anderson (ph).

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They're great leakers. (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But I have to just give you one factoid right now. The banks in Afghanistan are empty. There's not a dime left. They robbed everything. The United States has cut off all credit to Afghanistan. Nobody's picking up the garbage. The lights are going to go out soon that are still -- that are still burning. The water is not going to be working in a little bit. Those cell phones that they all treasure, the cell towers are going to go down. The reason the Taliban is playing ball right now is they know they have not a chance in Shinola to get that fixed without a whole lot of help. And if they don't play ball and let these people out, you know, I'm not saying anything -- I'm not trying to justify the mistakes that were made by us. But I believe that this situation, while not redeemable, we're not going to ever go back to Afghanistan. We do have some leverage right now to have a humane evacuation, but I think America has to come to grips with the fact that we're going to have tens of thousands of Afghans coming to America. Get over it. We're going to absorb. We're going to --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We're basically paying all these people to come out, that's what's happening.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And then when -- and then when it's done --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: (Inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- China and Pakistan are going to swoop in with the cash. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Anytime you decide you're going to leave, that's sending a signal, no matter what. So, I find that the worst thing that Biden is doing is blaming the Afghan army and saying that they didn't fight as hard because if you know that the exit's coming and everybody apparently knew this was coming, they also knew that the Taliban was going to become the new boss. So, why tangle with the new landlord? If you know that you're not going to get air power and you know the United States is leaving, it seems that the fast transition that the Afghan army was allowing was just them looking out for their self-interest. It's like what -- like why fight, why go down with the ship, right? If the ship -- why don't I just, you know, I don't want them to kill my family so we'll just let them in. They made deals. I think in terms of accountability, they have -- we have to go further back. There were -- I mean, again, I always say it's on my head. I take responsibility for ignoring certain things. And, you know, I ignored claims of well-documented stories about fraud and misuse of funds because it wasn't, like it was Afghanistan. It was so confusing and blah, blah, blah or it was maybe it was just part of anti-war assumptions that I thought were silly, but they ended up being right. You're talking like $600 billion lost in grifting and corruption out of a war that cost over a trillion. That needs to be looked at. Where did this money go? Who wanted this war to keep going to make money I think is a really good thing. And lastly, just a recommendation for a movie, one of the best war movies is an Afghanistan movie called "The Beast." I don't know if anybody have seen it, but it's probably around --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: How about the "Kite Runner?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I never saw that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know if it's a movie. The book, yes. I know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Good book.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The book's better than the movie, Geraldo. Right, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I was actually just going to say that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. Dana and I know. Ahead, President Biden ramping up his war on Republican governors who defy masked mandates and Ron DeSantis is hitting back hard.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Another major clash over mask mandates in schools. President Biden scolding Republican governors and directing his Department of Education to sue them for blocking mask restrictions. But Florida Governor Ron DeSantis is hitting back saying the president has other problems to worry about.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: Have you seen throughout this pandemic some politicians are trying to turn public safety measures that is children wearing masks in school into political disputes for their own political gain. If you aren't going to fight COVID-19, at least get out of the way.

utterances.speaker: RON DESANTIS, GOVERNOR OF FLORIDA
utterances.utterance: Joe Biden thinks the federal government should come in and overrule the parents and force these young kids to wear these masks. And you got to wonder, where are your priorities? You're letting Afghanistan burn, our border burn and so many other things in our country fall to pieces.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I like that guy, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But that is gaslighting. He is trying to change the subject. The subject is Florida leads the nation in the most new cases per capita. Florida leads the nation in the most hospitalizations per capita, and he's talking about Biden and Afghanistan. Why isn't he dealing with -- yes, he's running for president, I get that but.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I always -- I'm super skeptical when we only deal with a single variable like cases. I want to know what the severity is. I want to know are these people that aren't vaccinated are vaccinated? Are they elderly? Do they have other issues? That -- and are the cases asymptomatic? A lot of them are.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Are you arguing that COVID is not a problem in Florida and that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. No.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, that my point is he should --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm not going to -- I'm not getting into this --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He's being criticized by Biden about COVID. Mask mandates

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, Biden is doing -- Biden is doing this because he's in trouble. This is the only way he's going to maintain any relevance. He's mortally wounded by Afghanistan. So this debate is only here for artificial reasons. I think we live in a time now where we hold more contempt for our political adversaries than actual terrorists. It's why you keep hearing people from Michael Moore to Stephen Colbert comparing Republicans and Trump voters to the Taliban. Now, if I were -- if I were like them and god knows I'm not, I would point to the Democrats and say, it's interesting how maniacal they are about having people cover up. I mean, perhaps the mask is their burka, don't you think. I mean, the fact is, you know, they're so hot on mask mandates. They seem to have that same authoritarian inclination that the Taliban has, you know, for people to do what they say. But I would never say that --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, you would never.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because I'm not -- I'm not a hack. I will point out however that in Martha's Vineyard, the hospitals are seeing its largest number of COVID and non-COVID-related patients since the pandemic began. And a hack would probably point out that there was this massive big bash at Martha's Vineyard who by someone whose name might rhyme with --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I thought you were going to behave --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- Sharack Slobama, but I'm not going to do that. I'm going to say that the rise of COVID at Martha's Vineyard were a bunch of pro-Trump fishermen that just showed up there on the island.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Probably so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: So, Dana, would you -- how would you advise Governor DeSantis?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, the thing is that he's counterpunching, right? So, he didn't pick the fight with Biden. He is governing. So, he is the elected governor of Florida. He's saying, here's what I'm saying to schools. He's not saying you are not allowed to wear a mask at school. He's saying that there should be choice and I believe in like local control. I think that's good. But you mentioned that -- you think that DeSantis is gaslighting by changing the subject. That's exactly what President Biden did yesterday --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: When he came out and gave a whole speech about booster shots, which are fine. I mean, that's fine. But it was obviously not the issue of the day. And that is something that the Secretary of Health and Human Services or the vice president could have done for him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Also, I'm tired of people using the word gaslighting incorrectly. Just because people are having a debate --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I used it exactly correct.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Gaslighting is you -- something really bad is happening to you. And I'm telling you, it's not happening.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You get caught cheating, and you say why didn't you do the dishes? That's gaslighting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, perhaps. I've never done that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The dishes?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's a fact of life that Florida is suffering and DeSantis, you know, for all his swashbuckling, the proof is in the pudding.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: DeSantis is saying, as Republicans say that it's up to the parents to decide what's best for the kids. The Democrats are saying, I want the government to force what we think is best for all of the kids. And that's a great difference between the left and the right. DeSantis, as Dana said, he's not saying you're not allowed to wear a mask if you're a child, he just says you have the option. What's wrong with options? What's wrong with choice, Geraldo? That's the issue. And Biden thinks he's right on the polling, but he's wrong on the facts. There's a new study. 25,000 school-aged children, listen to these physical, psychological behavioral problems that have come from mask- wearing in schools. Increased headaches, difficulty concentrating -- I had that normally -- drowsiness or fatigue, malaise, sleep issues, shortness of breath, dizziness. Do you want children dizzy and passing out, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's gaslighting it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, you don't. And if there really was --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I feel -- I feel dizzy listening to that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, right, because the facts make you dizzy, Geraldo. And there hasn't been a school that's been a super spreader.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's is just not true. If there was, it'd be all over the news.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Dagen, despite everyone not answering my question --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I thought I did.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The fact of the matter is the federal courts will back the federal government on this issue. They already have. They started with Indiana University. It's going to spread throughout the country.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: That's on vaccine mandate.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I was carted at the hotel yesterday.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: For what?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: For --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Your AARP card?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes, both.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: That the Indiana case is a vaccine mandate. This is about providing parents with the choice of whether their kid, their tyke is going to wear a mask. And there is zero science to back up the effectiveness of mask-wearing among young children in. In fact, the World Health Organization says between ages five and 11 --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I am not --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Listen, I'm answering this. Between five and 11, you have to take into account the psychological issues of the child and the learning issues of the child before you put a mask on that kid for a long period of time. And if Joe Biden gave truly a flying damn about the lives of people in Texas, red state, Florida is a swing state, maybe he ought to get in front of the American people and say, if you have COVID, the first thing you need to do is ask your doctor about an antibody infusion. But he's not going to do that because didn't Governor Abbott have one? Oh, that crosses the line. You need to communicate with people if you're sick. This is what you do. Oh, and by the way, why hasn't the federal government bought any of the new antibody drug that was approved by the FDA? It's Vir Biotech and GlaxoSmithKline. They haven't even bought any of that. That's actually how you fight the pandemic if you get COVID. And it's up to the commander in chief of the nation to tell Floridians and Texans and everybody who lives in every state who might get COVID. But he didn't do that because he's making this a political issue because he's gasping for air.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't disagree with anything my colleagues have just told you, ladies and gentlemen. I really report to you that the federal government will be empowered by federal courts to deny Medicaid and Medicare reimbursements to nursing homes, 15,000 or more of them, because the federal government has that power. So, regardless of everything you've heard about mask good or bad or everything --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, Geraldo, you know what President Biden should do? Executive order declaring Halloween is every day.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Or it's my birthday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's just so important.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A red wave panic. Panic among Democrats as President Biden's approval ratings drop below 50 percent for the first time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is stupid.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: President Biden's approval rating is sinking fast as multiple crises pile up and it could screw things up for Democrats in the midterms next year.
